lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump may find it difficult to raise funds after being shunned by respected party figures including Mitt Romney, George Bush, George W. Bush and Paul D. Ryan.

headline.print_headline: Rift Grows Wide as Republicans Abandon Trump
headline.main: Donald Trump Seeks Republican Unity but Finds Rejection

snippet: Mr. Trump may find it difficult to raise funds after being shunned by respected party figures including Mitt Romney, George Bush, George W. Bush and Paul D. Ryan.
abstract: Rift in Republican party widens as Jeb Bush announces he will not back Donald Trump in general election and Trump attacks Sen Lindsay Graham for refusing to back his campaign; Republican strategist Ward Baker advises Republicans campaigning for Senate seats to feel free to skip party's nominating convention and focus on their home states, sign of party's reservations about Trump.
